alt: The Île de la Cité in autumn
caption: Shown here on the left is the Conciergerie, located on the west of the Île de la Cité. It was formerly a prison but is presently used mostly for law courts. During the French Revolution, the Queen, Marie-Antoinette, was [taken]({{% assets documents %}}an-expiatory-chapel-for-marie-antoinette.pdf) from the Conciergerie to be guillotined.
